meanings.definition: A genus of plants in the family Brassicaceae.
meanings.sent1: The crambe plant has beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: I learned about crambe in my botany class.
meanings.sent3: The crambe plant seemed to dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The crambe fields stretched out like a green carpet.
meanings.sent5: The crambe's leaves were a vibrant green, standing out in the garden.

meanings.definition: A type of vegetable similar to kale.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy cooking with crambe in my recipes.
meanings.sent2: The crambe salad was fresh and delicious.
meanings.sent3: The crambe vegetable made the dish taste even better.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was full of crambe, adding color to the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The crambe leaves were tender and flavorful when cooked.

meanings.definition: To stuff or fill tightly with food.
meanings.sent1: She would crambe the turkey with herbs before roasting.
meanings.sent2: I always crambe my sandwiches with extra cheese.
meanings.sent3: He tried to crambe all the snacks into his backpack.
meanings.sent4: The chef would crambe the pastries with cream filling.
meanings.sent5: The suitcase was crambeed with clothes for the trip.
